channel.title: List of Secure Computation Papers
channel.description: A list of papers on IACR eprint on the topic of secure computation.

item.title: On the Exact Round Complexity of Best-of-both-Worlds Multi-party Computation
item.description: Arpita Patra and Divya Ravi and Swati Singla

item.title: Attacking Threshold Wallets
item.description: Jean-Philippe Aumasson and Omer Shlomovits

item.title: Circuit Amortization Friendly Encodings and their Application to Statistically Secure Multiparty Computation
item.description: Anders Dalskov and Eysa Lee and Eduardo Soria-Vazquez

item.title: The Round Complexity of Secure Computation Against Covert Adversaries
item.description: Arka Rai Choudhuri and Vipul Goyal and Abhishek Jain

item.title: Towards Efficiency-Preserving Round Compression in MPC: Do fewer rounds mean more computation?
item.description: Prabhanjan Ananth and Arka Rai Choudhuri and Aarushi Goel and Abhishek Jain

item.title: Catalic: Delegated PSI Cardinality with Applications to Contact Tracing
item.description: Thai Duong and Duong Hieu Phan and Ni Trieu

item.title: Approximate Homomorphic Encryption with Reduced Approximation Error
item.description: Andrey Kim and Antonis Papadimitriou and Yuriy Polyakov

item.title: Secure training of decision trees with continuous attributes
item.description: Mark Abspoel and Daniel Escudero and Nikolaj Volgushev

item.title: Lower Bound for Oblivious RAM with Large Cells
item.description: Ilan Komargodski and Wei-Kai Lin

item.title: MOTION - A Framework for Mixed-Protocol Multi-Party Computation
item.description: Lennart Braun and Daniel Demmler and Thomas Schneider and Oleksandr Tkachenko

item.title: Secure Massively Parallel Computation for Dishonest Majority
item.description: Rex Fernando and Ilan Komargodski and Yanyi Liu and Elaine Shi

item.title: FHE-Based Bootstrapping of Designated-Prover NIZK
item.description: Zvika Brakerski and Sanjam Garg and Rotem Tsabary

item.title: Privacy-preserving greater-than integer comparison without binary decomposition in the malicious model
item.description: Sigurd Eskeland

item.title: On the Power of an Honest Majority in Three-Party Computation Without Broadcast
item.description: Bar Alon and Ran Cohen and Eran Omri and Tom Suad

item.title: Asymptotically Good Multiplicative LSSS over Galois Rings and Applications to MPC over Z/p^k Z
item.description: Mark Abspoel and Ronald Cramer and Ivan Damgård and Daniel Escudero and Matthieu Rambaud and Chaoping Xing and Chen Yuan

item.title: Silent Two-party Computation Assisted by Semi-trusted Hardware

item.title: (F)unctional Sifting: A Privacy-Preserving Reputation System Through Multi-Input Functional Encryption (extended version)

item.description: Michele Ciampi and Alexandru Cojocaru and Elham Kashefi and Atul Mantri

item.title: Efficient Composable Oblivious Transfer from CDH in the Global Random Oracle Model

item.title: Optimal Oblivious Parallel RAM
item.description: Gilad Asharov and Ilan Komargodski and Wei-Kai Lin and Enoch Peserico and Elaine Shi

item.title: Multiparty Cardinality Testing for Threshold Private Set Intersection
item.description: Pedro Branco and Nico Döttling and Sihang Pu

item.title: Adaptively secure Threshold Symmetric-key Encryption

item.title: Fantastic Four: Honest-Majority Four-Party Secure Computation With Malicious Security
